subsc: Central government administration,Mining and other extractive

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Reengagement and Reform
            Support Grant Project for Guinea were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory; risk to development outcome
            was high; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory; and
            borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned includes: when, after a steep downward
            spiral, conditions in a country change for the better, it is
            important for the Bank to seize the opportunity in a speedy
            way. Prior actions for a re-engagement operation should be
            simple and should not require extensive preparatory work.
            They should demonstrate the Government commitment to make a
            break with the past practices, which led the country into
            default. An action plan should be agreed upon with the
            Government to ensure that the reform process proceeds in an
            efficient way after Board approval. The letter of
            development policy should provide a framework for monthly
            monitoring of the action plan by the Government and the
            Bank. Technical assistance is generally needed to help the
            Government move beyond the prior actions. A technical
            assistance project is under preparation, but its processing
            is taking much longer than anticipated. The country office
            should be responsible for monitoring program implementation
            on a monthly basis. All re-engagement operations are highly
            risky. Experience shows that the high benefits of these
            operations generally outweigh their high risks. It shows
            also that the risk of not doing anything may have highly
            negative consequences.
